actions.text: Amendment SA 96 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

Amendment SA 96 proposed by Senator Menendez to Amendment SA 65. (consideration: CR S789; text: CR S789) To clarify that the amendment shall not be construed as a declaration of war or an authorization of the use of military force.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 96 proposed by Senator Menendez to Amendment SA 65.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 96 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

amends_amendment.purpose: To express the sense of the Senate that the United States faces continuing threats from terrorist groups operating in Syria and Afghanistan and that the precipitous withdrawal of United States forces from either country could put at risk hard-won gains and United States national security.

purpose: To clarify that the amendment shall not be construed as a declaration of war or an authorization of the use of military force.
